properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Northerly winds will reach up to 90 kilometres per hour beginning Monday afternoon. They will diminish gradually overnight. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-18T12:31:15-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-17T20:32:15-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1358521182.2021
Area: Kangiqsujuaq - Raglan Lake, Kangirsuk
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions will occur in these communities beginning Monday. A blizzard warning is issued when winds are expected to produce blowing snow with widespread visibilities of 400 metres or less for at least 6 hours. ### Visibility will be suddenly reduced to near zero at times in heavy snow and blowing snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-18T08:27:00-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-17T16:28:00-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1902792995.2021
Area: Kangirsuk, Aupaluk, Tasiujaq

properties.Title: Wreckhouse Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Dangerous wind gusts are expected or occurring. Maximum winds: southeasterly gusting up to 140 km/h. Locations: the Wreckhouse area. Time span: continuing until this afternoon. ### Drivers may lose control of their vehicles; tall vehicles are at risk of being overturned. Wreckhouse wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-01-17T22:59:31-00:00

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with poor visibility in snow and blowing snow are expected or occurring. Strong northwest winds and falling snow are creating blizzard conditions over Naujaat today. Visibilities will be reduced to 400 metres or less in blowing snow. Conditions will improve this evening when the winds abate. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-18T05:17:02-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-17T22:14:02-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3305841636.2021
Area: Naujaat

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 15 to 25 cm is expected. Locations: Nain and Vicinity Time span: beginning tonight to near noon on Monday. Remarks: Winds are expected to increase overnight tonight and cause some blowing snow over exposed areas for a brief period. By early Monday morning, temperatures will settle near zero and any blowing snow should cease. Conditions will improve quickly near noon on Monday. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-01-18T11:46:23-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-17T19:47:23-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3268728728.2021
Area: Nain and vicinity

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. A deep low pressure system over the Gulf of Alaska will approach the region on Monday. As a result, heavy snow and strong winds will develop over the Haines Road and South Klondike Highway Monday morning. The storm will rage through the day and into the night. The snow and winds will eventually abate early Tuesday morning. ### Road closures are possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #YTStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-18T05:35:42-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-17T13:36:42-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3197057941.2021
Area: Haines Road - Haines Junction to Pleasant Camp, South Klondike Highway - Carcross to White Pass
properties.Author: Environment Canada
